page.title: 01CLOWNE AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: CLOWNE IS LARGE VILLAGE IN NORTH EAST DERBYSHIRE.IN 1980 IT HAD A POPULATION OF 6750. THE MAIN SOURCE OF EMPLOYMENT IN THE VILLAGE IS A KNITWEAR FACTORY.MOST OF THE MALE EMPLOYMENT WITHIN THE VILLAGE IS AT A NATIONAL BUS COMPANY GARAGE AND A HAULAGE COMPANY.OTHER EMPLOYMENT BEING PROVIDED IN A NUMBER OF SMALL INDUSTRIAL UNITS,SHOPS AND EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS.MANY PEOPLE PARTICULARY MALES WORK OUTSIDE CLOWNE. OVER THE LAST 15 YEARS THE VILLAGE HAS EXPANDED DRAMATICALLY WITH THE BUILDING OF A NUMBER OF PRIVATE HOUSING ESTATES.AS THE RESULT OF THE GROWTH IN POPULATION IN RECENT YEARS NEW INFANT AND JUNIOR SCHOOLS HAVE BEEN BUILT. THE LAND SURROUNDING THE VILLAGE IS FARMLAND WHICH IS MAINLY USED FOR GROWING CEREALS.
